data.title: Farrah Falcone, Author at Tailwind Group
data.text:
Tailwind Group’s Fourth Student Housing Acquisition in 2024

Tailwind Group and its partners are pleased to announce the recent acquisition of Campus Trails, a 156-unit, 480-bedroom property in Starkville, MS. The property is located right across the street from Mississippi State University’s campus. The asset consists of 2-bedroom and 4-bedroom units. The asset was purchased from an undisclosed seller and the deal was brokered by William Vonderfecht and his team at CBRE.

Over the next 12 months, the property will undergo renovations which will include strategic unit upgrades, repurposing of the interior and exterior amenity spaces, and general property enhancements. The property will also be re-branded in the fall of 2024.

“We are excited to add another property in an SEC market, which have proven to be very strong for us in recent years” said Brandon Smith, Tailwind Group’s Vice President of Operations & Development. “The premiere location to campus and ability to add-value to both residents and the property through strategic property renovations cement our belief in this asset and our business plan.”

Tailwind Group is a top-20 owner and manager of off-campus student housing in the country, with 36 different communities comprising approximately 16,500 bedrooms in their portfolio. Their reach spans across 15 states and 20 universities.

Inquiries:

Brandon Smith, VP of Operations & Development

Krystal Pierce, VP of Investments & General Counsel

August 1st, 2024|

Episode 3: Growth, Vision, and Opportunities

Tailwind Group is thrilled to announce the third episode of Tailwind Talks!

In this episode, Brandon Smith, Vice President of Operations and Development, and our special guest, Michael Sather, one of the four founding partners of Tailwind, cover a range of topics, including Michael’s background, the formation and growth of Tailwind Group, as well as his current focus and future plans within the company. Additionally, listeners get a quick segment from Dave Hughes, Director of Information Technology, and Zach Rubosky, Talent Acquisition Specialist, about the hiring process at Tailwind and what potential job seekers can expect when applying to Tailwind Group.

Whether you’re an experienced investor, an ambitious professional, or simply intrigued about the world of real estate, our episodes promise to inform, inspire, and keep you eagerly anticipating what’s next for Tailwind Group.

July 30th, 2024|

Tailwind Group Acquires The Gramercy in Manhattan, Kansas

Tailwind Group and its partners are pleased to announce the recent acquisition of The Gramercy, a 228-unit, 700-bedroom property in Manhattan, KS. The property is located right across the street from historic Bill Synder Family Stadium near Kansas State University’s campus. The asset consists of 2-bedroom and 4-bedroom units. The asset was purchased from an undisclosed seller.

Over the next 13 months, the property will undergo renovations which will include strategic unit upgrades, repurposing of the interior and exterior amenity spaces, and general property enhancements. The property will also be re-branded in the fall of 2024.

“We have kept our eye on the Manhattan market for the past several years, and felt like the timing was right to enter,” said Brandon Smith, Tailwind Group’s Vice President of Operations & Development. “This purchase reinforces Tailwind Group’s commitment to pursue value-add opportunities in the student housing sector. Our team is extremely excited to launch our re-brand and implement our capital improvement plan over the next year.”

Tailwind Group is a top-20 owner and manager of off-campus student housing in the country, with 35 different communities comprising approximately 16,200 bedrooms in their portfolio. Their reach spans across 15 states and 19 universities.

Inquiries:

Brandon Smith, VP of Operations & Development

Krystal Pierce, VP of Investments & General Counsel

July 25th, 2024|

Tailwind Group Acquires Second Property in Lawrence, Kansas

Tailwind Group and its partners are pleased to announce the recent acquisition of The Reserve on West 31st, a 192-unit, 720-bedroom property in Lawrence, KS. The property is located near the University of Kansas and consists of 3-bedroom and 4-bedroom units. The asset was purchased from an undisclosed seller and was brokered by Teddy Leatherman and her team at JLL.

Over the next 14 months, the property will undergo extensive renovations which include full unit upgrades, conversion of 4-bedroom, 2-bathroom units to 4-bedroom, 4-bathroom units, a complete redesign and repurposing of the interior and exterior amenity spaces, and general property enhancements. The property will also be re-branded in the fall of 2024.

“We see great upside in this opportunity upon execution of our capital improvement plan combined with the strong fundamentals in the Lawrence market,” said Brandon Smith, Tailwind Group’s Vice President of Operations & Development. “The University of Kansas has seen tremendous enrollment growth over the past few years and the need for high-quality, off-campus student housing is at a premium. This deal lined up perfectly with our opportunistic, value-add strategy.”

Tailwind Group is a top-20 owner and manager of off-campus student housing in the country, with 34 different communities comprising nearly 15,500 bedrooms in their portfolio. Their reach spans across 15 states and 18 universities.

Inquiries:

Brandon Smith, VP of Operations & Development

Krystal Pierce, VP of Investments & General Counsel

June 27th, 2024|

Episode 2: Insight on Investments

Tailwind Group is excited to announce the second episode of Tailwind Talks.

In this episode, join host David Hughes, Director of Information Technology and special guest Bryce Andrews, Investors Relations Associate as they share their backgrounds, the story of their friendship, and how they found themselves working at Tailwind Group. Get an insider’s look at a day in the life of an investment professional and enjoy a fun trivia game to get to know our employees. Plus, don’t miss updates from Carli Davis, Social Media Manager and Dylan Gregory, Outreach Marketing Specialist on our monthly Leasing Belt and Social Icon winners.

Highlights Include:

Meet Bryce Andrews and learn about his background and current role at Tailwind

Tailwind Trivia Challenge

Investor Events and Engagement

Introduction of Carli and Dylan and the Social Icon and Leasing Belt Award

Whether you’re a seasoned investor, an aspiring professional, or simply curious about the world of real estate, our episodes promise to inform, inspire, and keep you eagerly anticipating what’s next for Tailwind Group.

Follow us on social media: @tailwindgroupinc on Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, and LinkedIn, and @tailwindgroup on YouTube. For inquiries and feedback, reach out to us via email. Don’t forget to subscribe and share the podcast with your friends!

June 18th, 2024|

Tailwind Group Unveils Transformed Clubhouse and New Property Name in Baton Rouge, LA

Tailwind Group acquired The Sterling in Baton Rouge, LA on March 29, 2023 and quickly put a plan in place to improve the resident experience through an improved amenity package. These upgrades, completed over the last 10 months, included updating outdoor furnishings, a brand-new fitness center and brand-new clubhouse with ample community and study space for residents.

When asked about his outlook on the project, Jon Fahning, Director of Development said “The project came with a series of challenges – weather, unforeseen conditions with the buildings discovered during the work, and schedule just to name a few. The construction team rose to the challenge and truly presented the partnership we strive for on all our projects. The on-site team was awesome in working closely with us to deliver the project to Tailwind’s expectations and standards. Great job by all!”

In addition to the renovation project, Tailwind Group’s marketing team, in partnership with the operational team, began the process of rebranding the property to one of Tailwind Group’s newer core brands, Altitude.

“Altitude is a newer brand for us that we introduced in May of 2023, with the acquisition and rebrand in Wichita, KS. The brand was intended to be used moving forward for future mid-rise and high-rise acquisitions. The tagline ‘Elevate your living,’ can certainly be attributed to the style of property but is definitely meant to signify the elevated living experience a student would have if they chose to live with us. We love this brand and were excited to bring it to Baton Rouge.” – Devan Schaly-Brumbaugh, Director of Leasing and Marketing

As discussed on the pilot episode of the Tailwind Talks podcast, for Tailwind Group a rebrand is more than just swapping out signage and brochures. Tailwind Group’s marketing team works meticulously for months to craft a campaign that excites the local community about the name change. This campaign culminates in a launch party that takes place onsite and is open to residents, prospective residents, and members of the community. Altitude Baton Rouge’s rebrand party attracted over 130 attendees and featured limited edition t-shirts, a crawfish boil, and giveaways such as a Nintendo Switch.

When asked about the launch, Nicky Tyus, Property Manager, said “The team brought the energy and the residents and other attendees responded with tons of excitement regarding the renovations and name change. I was overjoyed to see the residents and staff having such a good time. I’m extremely proud of our team and the efforts made to ensure the event, unveiling of the property renovations and name change were a success!”

Tailwind Group is a top-20 owner and manager of off-campus student housing in the country, with 33 different communities comprising nearly 15,000 bedrooms in their portfolio. Their reach spans across 15 states and 18 universities.

Inquiries:

Jon Fahning, Director of Development

Devan Schaly-Brumbaugh, Director of Leasing and Marketing

June 5th, 2024|

2024 Tailwind Group Operations & Budget Summit Awards

The 4th Annual Tailwind Group Operations & Budget Summit took place April 15 – April 18 in Mankato, Minnesota, Tailwind Group headquarters. Property Managers, Resident Services Managers, and corporate team members traveled from various locations for three days of learning, collaboration, and celebrations! Our employees celebrated with a dinner and awards ceremony on the final night at Sky One Eleven Event Center.

Tailwind Group honored our property sites and individuals who met and exceeded Tailwind Group’s standards for excellence.

College Town Mankato (MaKayla Kies) achieved the Living the Difference: Best Renewal % in the Portfolio for the 2nd year in a row at 48.8%.

The Quarters Cedar Falls (Mariah Fordyce) achieved the Best Rent Collection % in the Portfolio at 99.65%.

109 Tower (Cortavious Givens) took home the Largest Year-Over-Year NOI $ Increase at $1,047,508.

The largest Year-Over-Year NOI % Increase was awarded to The Quarters Oxford (D’Andre Webb) with 86%.

For the second year in a row, The Quarters Vermillion (Faith Acosta) was awarded Top Resident Reputation in the Portfolio.

The following is a list of our 2024 Operations & Budget Summit nominees and award winners. Please join us in congratulating them!

Tailwind Group believes in recognizing the hard work and dedication of our employees. Our company culture thrives on appreciation, teamwork, and excellence. We understand that our employees’ dedication, passion, and hard work are the cornerstones of our success. Thank you to our employees for your efforts, innovative ideas, and your unwavering support of Tailwind Group. Your contributions make a significant impact on our company daily!

May 7th, 2024|

Episode 1: Pilot

In this inaugural episode of Tailwind Talks, join hosts Brandon Smith, Vice President of Operations & Development, and Devan Schaly-Brumbaugh, Director of Leasing & Marketing, as they dive into the purpose and creation of the podcast, highlight our recent acquisition in St. Louis, break down our Operations and Budget Summit, and talk about some exciting things in the pipeline at Tailwind.

Highlights Include:

Acquisitions and Expansion: Dive into the strategic acquisitions that propelled Tailwind Group from local success to a nationwide presence. Learn how the team identified opportunities, navigated challenges, and capitalized on emerging markets to build a diverse portfolio.

Rebranding and Innovation: Explore the process of rebranding and how Tailwind Group has continuously adapted to meet the evolving needs of its tenants and communities. From purpose-built student housing to commercial development projects, uncover the innovative approaches that set Tailwind apart.

Leadership Insights: Gain valuable insights into effective leadership practices as Brandon and Devan share their experiences and lessons learned from leading within the Tailwind family. Discover how a culture of collaboration, integrity, and ambition drives success at every level of the organization.

Operations and Budget Summit: Get an insider’s look into Tailwind Group’s operation and budget summit, where strategic planning and fiscal responsibility converge to ensure continued growth and profitability. Learn how meticulous planning and attention to detail are key drivers of success in the competitive real estate market.

Preview of Roy Hall Jr’s Conference: Be the first to hear about the exciting upcoming conference hosted by industry luminary Roy Hall Jr.

Join us for an engaging conversation filled with insights, anecdotes, and a shared vision for the future of Tailwind Group. Whether you’re a seasoned investor, aspiring developer, or simply curious about the world of real estate, this episode promises to inform, inspire, and leave you eagerly anticipating what lies ahead for Tailwind Talks. Stay connected with us for more insightful discussions and updates.

Follow us on social media: @tailwindgroupinc on Facebook, Instagram, and LinkedIn, and @tailwindgroup on YouTube. For inquiries and feedback, reach out to us via email. Don’t forget to subscribe and share the podcast with your friends!

May 7th, 2024|

Tailwind Group’s First Acquisition of 2024

Tailwind Group and its partners are pleased to announce the acquisition of 3949 Apartments, a 197-unit, 256-bedroom property in St. Louis, MO. The property is located just steps away from St. Louis University and consists of studios, one-bedroom, and two-bedroom apartments. This acquisition is Tailwind Group’s first of 2024 and first exposure to the St. Louis market. The asset was purchased from Greystar and was brokered by Ryan Lang and his team at Newmark.

Upon closing, the property was rebranded to The Landing at St. Louis. Tailwind Group has immediate plans to renovate the leasing office, amenity spaces, and various common areas throughout the building.

“We were excited to get this transaction to the finish line,” said Krystal Pierce, Tailwind Group’s Vice President of Investments and General Counsel. “While St. Louis University is not a traditional Power-5 school that we typically enter, we are extremely optimistic about the growing enrollment and stability of SLU as well as the premiere location relative to campus. With our planned renovations and management plan, we believe this will be a very strong asset in our student housing portfolio.”

Tailwind Group is a top-20 owner and manager of off-campus student housing in the country, with 33 different communities comprising nearly 15,000 bedrooms in their portfolio. Their reach spans across 15 states and 18 universities.

Inquiries:

Brandon Smith, VP of Operations & Development

Krystal Pierce, VP of Investments & General Counsel

April 22nd, 2024|
